Topic.Title: Was yesterday's close and this morning's pop a "shot across the bow"?

Message.Msg: Thanks. I only went to Wall St. to make enough money to buy a Country Inn, which I did after 8 or so years there. I had the Kedron Valley Inn for 17 years, and sold it 10 1/2 years ago, but once I got it on the road to "recovery" (it's the 8th or 9th longest continuously running Inn or Tavern in VT, circa 1828) I would do a show every other year while doing a major renovation. Living in the country and having a "family business" where any kids I had would grow up as "part of something" was the other thing I wanted to do other than perform. So, when those two parts didn't come my way, I decided that I'd do my performing in smaller venues in the country once I had established the business. It turned out well. Best, Max

Topic.Title: Microsoft is offering Office 2013 for free for Win 8 touch screen tablets. Win RT

Message.Msg: The free Office 2013 offer only applies to touchscreen notebooks smaller than 10.8 inches. Best buy has also discounted all Win 8 notebooks $100 too. But alas you still have to buy Microsoft Office for the Surface Pro and you still get it free with Surface RT. Note: It looks like Microsoft is trying to kill the Surface PRO with what they are charging. JMHO

Message.Title: Tegra growth driver...
Message.Msg: in off-the-record discussions with the developers, we learned that Nvidia no longer invests as much in PC gaming developer teams as it used to, as Tegra is viewed as the main growth driver for the company. Naturally, this is purely one sided view, but a view coming from several game development companies which combined shipped over 100 million units. brightsideofnewsDOTcom/news/2013/3/6/tomb-raider-amd-touts-tressfx-hair-as-nvidia-apologizes-for-poor-experience.aspx

Message.Title: NVDA trading at 10 AM: uptick volume/downtick volume = 3 to 1
Message.Msg: Normally this time of the day would show NVDA at its day low, but now today; very positive moneyflow is seen instead. Below from WSJ: ___ Uptick/Downtick Trade Ratio: 2.97 Net Money Flow $1.73 M About Money Flow Money flow gives a snapshot of relative buying and selling pressure in a stock. A ratio above one suggests greater buying pressure, below one suggests greater selling.

Topic.Title: Nvidia AT Wedbush Conference 8:35M ET - You Can Listen Live

Message.Msg: John-I think you're right. It sounded quite "coy", and I remember how Jensen seemed when he first spoke on CNBC, in 1999, when I first bought the stock. He looked like the "cat that swallowed the canary" and was so coy that I had to buy. I think they'll not only give better and higher guidance (I really think that the guidance was sandbagging the analysts), but that might be the event where they give the pricing, etc, for Project Shield. IF the market starts to understand that, then we should see a major run up by the end of next week in anticipation of those things. It might also be why we're already seeing signs of a better technical picture and why the stock is trading better on that front. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Best, Max

Topic.Title: NVIDIA Corporation SURVEY!

Message.Msg: I just read your article. Impressive.

Topic.Title: Nvidia AT Wedbush Conference 8:35M ET - You Can Listen Live

Message.Msg: Don't know about timing, but I do feel the presentation answered a lot of questions head on by relating to events last year. I do hope they clarify pricing on Project Shield and the GTC conference would be a great place while they are surrounded by the entire gaming developer community. Two things I picked up over the last week. Qualcomm is now saying they are hiring 35 game developers....to work up games optimized for their chips and today's announcement that Nvidia is Supporting Physx and Apex for PS4 games. Bottom line--Nvidia is driving open source gaming which Consoles in the past have not been. Make one game edition and sell it everywhere. Uncharted territory so how can a financial analyst profile Project Shield's potential. Did notice that the IR guy said The Shield will run android and stream PC games and soon from Nvidia's Grid! That's a killer app in my opinion if and when it comes to fruition.

Topic.Title: Nvidia AT Wedbush Conference 8:35M ET - You Can Listen Live

Message.Msg: Thanks for posting... upbeat... Jensen to speak to the financial community following the keynote... GTC gonna be about GRID... Project Denver annoucement on March 19 ??

Topic.Title: Nvidia AT Wedbush Conference 8:35M ET - You Can Listen Live

Message.Msg: Pricing will be set when NV decides on one of the last set of specs, ie. storage, clock speeds, etc. I expect the official leaks will come out in early May, around the time when NV reports 1st Q earnings, probably not sooner. NV has been floating a lot of trial balloons in the gaming community as to what the (various levels of) gamers would be willing to pay....and then figure out the metrics after taking both long-term and short- term considerations. Project Shield is a revolutionary product, a decision made now will impact NV's financials in the years to come...can't be a hasty job.

Topic.Title: Nvidia Is Now Claiming I500 is Only 40% The Size of QCOM's MDM9215 Modem

Message.Msg: As you love those cheap commodity ARM chips so much you won't mind if they undercut Nvidia too ? digitimesDOTcom/news/a20130306PD220.html 'China ARM chipmakers gaining attention from first-tier vendors Monica Chen, Taipei; Joseph Tsai, DIGITIMES [Wednesday 6 March 2013] With their success in the white-box tablet market, China-based ARM chipmakers Rockchip and Allwinner Technology have started gaining attention from brand vendors worldwide with some first-tier brand vendors even considering adopting the solutions for their entry-level models, according to sources from the upstream supply chain. Allwinner shipped more than 50 million chips in 2012 with 70% of the volume supplied to markets outside of China. Because its solution's price is only half that of global first-tier chipmakers, the company's share in the tablet market is expected to rise further in 2013. Rockchip has successfully landed orders for HP's new 7-inch entry-level tablets, while Allwinner is currently still in negotiations with some first-tier brand vendors for orders. Allwinner is currently offering its dual-core chip at a price of US$5, an upgraded dual-core model, priced at below US$10, and a quad-core chip, priced only half that of Nvidia's Tegra 3. Since Allwinner's quad-core solution does not have a large performance gap compared to Tegra 3, orders started growing in the second half of 2012 and are expected to continue staying strong in 2013.' Be careful what you wish for ;-)

Message.Title: What is nvidia Up To With This?
Message.Msg: "Just because the PlayStation 4 centers around an AMD-based platform doesn't mean that NVIDIA is out of the picture. The graphics firm is updating the software developer kits for both its Apex dynamics framework and PhysX physics modeling system to address Sony's new console, even if they won't have the full hardware acceleration that comes with using NVIDIA's own chipsets. The introductions will mostly take some of the guesswork out of creating realistic-looking games -- theoretically, adding a larger number of collisions, destructible objects and subtler elements like cloth and hair modeling. Most of us won't see the fruits of the updated SDKs until at least this holiday, but programmers looking for more plausible PS4 game worlds can hit the source links."

Message.Title: ASUS AiO marrying Intel Core i3 Win 8 (with GT730M graphics) and Tegra 3+....launching Q2
Message.Msg: Read Engadget's review: "We were beginning to think the ASUS Transformer AiO was just a figment of a summer daydream after hearing nothing of it since our chance look many months ago. As it turns out, we were right about the furtive FCC filing last December, and with all that paperwork in order, we've now been granted a formal introduction. The Transformer AiO (all-in-one) is very true to its name, as like the Autobots, it has two completely different configurations. In desktop mode, you're looking at a Windows 8 machine running on a Core i3 / i5 / i7, with a 2GB NVIDIA GeForce GT730M GPU, between 4 and 8GB of RAM, and up to a 2TB SATA HDD. It also has a DVD-RW optical drive (can you believe it?), a card reader, a bunch of ports and even a TV Tuner should you want one. Being a Windows 8 rig, it's not surprising that the 18.4-inch, 1,920 x 1,080 IPS display has ten-point multitouch, but it gets even more interesting when you free that screen from its desktop restraints. Popping it from the dock means you're now looking at a monster tablet with its own internal specs: a quad-core Tegra 3, 2 gigs of RAM and 32GB of flash storage. If you're in the mood to continue peering at Redmond's squares, it'll work as a remote terminal for the "PC Station." But, if you've got a sweet tooth, you can switch the slate to Android mode and knock around in 4.1 Jelly Bean. The Transformer AiO (P1801) is expected to be available in North America early second quarter at $1,299 for the basic model, which doesn't sound all that extortionate given the versatility of the desktop-come-tablet. Head to the source link for the full spec sheet, or check out the video below if you'd like a visual tour." NVIDIA has 2 parts in this dual-OS computer tablet: a high enough graphic card running on Win8 and an Tegra 3 SoC running Android"

Topic.Title: What is nvidia Up To With This?

Message.Msg: Does not seem to match with their website World-Class Capabilities & Coverage PhysX is a scalable multi-platform game physics solution supporting a wide range of devices, from smartphones to high-end multicore CPUs. While the PhysX SDK is designed primarily for game developers, it is also used by researchers, educators, and simulation application developers who need real time performance and robust behavior. Features include discrete and continuous collision detection, raycasting and shape sweeps, solvers for rigid body dynamics, fluids, and particles, as well as vehicle and character controllers. Real World Experience PhysX has been used in almost 300 games, and with many more currently in development across all major gaming platforms, the PhysX SDK is a favorite with hundreds of game studios and publishers around the world. The popularity of PhysX does not stop there. Because the binary build of the PhysX can be used freely for both non-commercial and commercial applications, with no license fees or royalties, the PhysX SDK has been downloaded by tens of thousands of enthusiasts worldwide, including: professional and indie game developers students and instructors from grade school through graduate school industrial simulation specialists commercial game engine developers producers of middleware and digital content creation tools. Better Games On All Platforms PhysX has been scoring design wins across a wide spectrum of products because the SDK makes it easier and faster to develop better games and applications than one could otherwise. PhysX is a complete physics solution that enables realistic game play, compelling simulations, and dynamic effects. PhysX is a proven top competitor among physics engines and supports all major gaming platforms, from mobile devices and consoles to multicore PC's both with or without GPU acceleration. Download your copy today, and get started with PhysX-3!

Message.Title: Project Shield
Message.Msg: I listened to the Wedbush Conference for a 2nd time this afternoon. Generally thought Presentation was of excellent and took on several of the questions overhanging Nvidia's PPS head on. It did come through loud and clear the recommend for investors to listen to the GTC keynote address and financial presentation March 19th. New product introductions would be highlighted. This was spoken right after Nvidia Grid and Project Shield was spoken about. May just be the normal months long Nvidia marketing hype up to introduction, but perhaps not. I also thought it was very telling that the Wedbush analyst characterized Project Shield as a hit with gamers but not with the financial analysts. Thought this was very true and impossible to change that opinion until more details about the product are released. My own personal opinion is Project Shield will be accretive to revenue and profits with the only question being by how much but it would behove Nvidia to announce the pricing and start taking pre-orders as soon as possible. One feature I would love to see is something very old school but quite lucrative...i.e. make Project Shield upgradeable like Gaming PC's are with the ability to swap out the CPU/GPU when each new Tegra edition comes out. A swappable motherboard...pull out the Tegra 4 module and replace with the new Tegra 5 module keeping your controller and screen as is or heck just buy a whole new Project Shield. Pay X for this years model and Pay X minus for next years Tegra module and plug in to your old Project Shield. Won't happen but just thought it would be a huge money maker for the company.

Topic.Title: Project Shield

Message.Msg: With the rate of improvement in displays, I don't see the advantage in upgrading the CPU/GPU only. Hard-core gamers who want a new processor will want a new LCD by next year anyway.

Topic.Title: Project Shield

Message.Msg: "Presentation was of excellent and took on several of the questions overhanging Nvidia's PPS head on." Yes, he was prepared... no doubt he's been asked the same questions over & over... "Shield as a hit with gamers but not with the financial analysts." and will stay that way until those analysts' kids want a Project Shield... " just buy a whole new Project Shield. " that's the plan...

Topic.Title: Project Shield

Message.Msg: "With the rate of improvement in displays, I don't see the advantage in upgrading the CPU/GPU only. Hard-core gamers who want a new processor will want a new LCD by next year anyway.With the rate of improvement in displays, I don't see the advantage in upgrading the CPU/GPU only. Hard-core gamers who want a new processor will want a new LCD by next year anyway." Perhaps you are right panacro. But I do like the idea of upgrading like you can with discrete GPUs in PCs. But if Nvidia selects Gamestop as their primary distributor then an individual can essentially do the same. Gamestop buys the Tegra 4 Project Shield for $129 and sells you the Tegra 5 for $299. Same difference as an upgrade kit for $129. I like it...sort of like the use car market. They have value and why fill up the landfills and pollute the earth when you don't have to..OK I spent some years in California and a little bit of green rubbed off me.

Topic.Title: What is nvidia Up To With This?

Message.Msg: He he I am a computer scientist / cand.scient. I work in the financial industry in Denmark as internal IT developer. Physx and Apex are two awesome technologies and clearly Sony and Nvidia have an ongoing relationship. Perhabs the action is the best strategy for gamers and business relationships / not necessarily near term income. Having PS4 using Physx and Apex underscores Nvidias dominance and enables Nvidia to maintain their feature and performance edge when using Geforce. On another note / the other day Nvidia demoed a ported PS3 game to Android that also used Physx if my memory serves me correct. Perhabs it also makes it easier to port between platforms. There is some speculation about using the old PS3s in cloud gaming for providing backwards compability to PS4. Reusing unsold stock on one hand sounds smart but I do not think they have the necessary compute density to make it energy efficient like Nvidias custom Grid server platform. Therefore I believe Nvidia Grid still has some chance in Sony's Gaikai solution. We will see. Take care /Frank.

Topic.Title: What is nvidia Up To With This?

Message.Msg: Thanks Frank, As always you are informative. You represent what stock message boards were originally set up to be. A free form sharing of information from knowledgeable sources! Thank You!

Topic.Title: Ibexx

Message.Msg: There are 2 parts to the NVIDIA-SONY licensing development. 1. Nvidia Corp. on Tuesday extended the licensing agreement with Sony over licensing of physX software originally developed by Ageia and licensed to Sony about four years ago (not free). Under the terms of the new agreement, Nvidia’s PhysX SDK will be available to registered PlayStation 3 platform video game creators for free download and use on the SCEI Developer Network. PS3 users have been receiving free downloads and will continue to do so. 2. Nvidia Corp. on Thursday announced support for Sony Computer Entertainment's PlayStation 4 with the popular Nvidia PhysX and Nvidia APEX software development kits (SDKs). (Most probably not free) Similarly, future PS4 gamers would likely have access to free downloads. It's interesting that in NVIDIA's announcement, it says, "The PhysX technology source code SDKs for PS3 and all major gaming platforms are available for license directly from Nvidia."

Topic.Title: Project Shield

Message.Msg: Also if the price is somewhat near 300 dollars then the device is easier to just accummulate. Keep the old generation to play with your friend in multiplayer. Give it to your chilld. Give it to your mother and let her enjoy some of the newer technologies. Usually my kids and parents inherit many of my older devices. But the thought of trading the old device in for a newer model with discount also seems quite feasible and would allow younger persons to upgrade more often.

Topic.Title: New information re Icera modem disclosed at the Wedbush presentation today

Message.Msg: last year 'Tegra' sales was supposedly to be $540M. How much does 3G modems sell for? $3? $2.50? How about we'll say $2.00? So last year's $540M Tegra sales, a minimum of $200M was due to 'cheap' radios. Wow, the 'progress' of Tegra sales is REALLY encouraging, isn't it? "How do you model Tegra sales?"

Message.Title: Will Nvidia's discrete graphics marketshare decline to 10% by the end of this year.

Topic.Title: Ibexx

Message.Msg: You and I would never be privy to all the terms in business contracts. In general...yes, licensing a technology is not free. Did you ever read the CUDA licensing agreement? - It says that the software part is free because licensee is paying for NVIDIA hardware.

Intel I5 part#3317 mobile chip list $225. Device cost $899 without Microsoft Office? Why is Microsoft adding 6 countries to distribution for WIN RT surface at $499 with Microsoft Office. Bringing total countries for Win RT to 26. Intel Surface Pro is still 2! And more importantly when will those Cambridge Dons at ARM get awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics! Topic.Title: Ibexx

Message.Msg: Licensing agreements like this are rarely "blank-fee-covers-all", it is usually based on number of users/downloads etc. Thus, in a sense, you can call it individual royalty payment - only that the console vendors pay for it, not the consumers directly. Naturally the cost gets passed on....
